ygData.subject: Re: Pet Question . ..
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks Peter . . .      Does anyone know why I would want my skel to sit down? Does it give any advantage, like can I have him sit down if  a guard is coming
ygData.messageBody:
Thanks Peter . . . Does anyone know why I would want my skel to sit
down? Does it give any advantage, like can I have him sit down if a guard
is coming and I go invis and then have him stand up after the guard is gone?


----- Original Message -----
From: Peter Smith <jaded@...>
To: <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, May 18, 1999 7:32 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] Pet Question . ..


> From: "Peter Smith" <jaded@...>
>
> The level one pet spell is fairly useless. Basically you're summoning a
decaying skeleton, and you know how easily they die, right? Push on to level
4 and you'll find your new pet much more useful.
>
>
> *********** REPLY SEPARATOR ***********
>
> On 5/18/99, at 7:27 AM, Mata wrote:
>
> >From: "Mata" <mata_eq@...>
> >
> >So I have a problem, every pet I have summoned has been L1! I made it
to
> >level 2 yesterday and I summoned 13 skeletons thus far and every single
one
> >was L1 (coned black while I was 1 and blue while I was 2)
> >I read several places that at low lvls we should be able to summon a pet
> >that could be above our lvl, I'd be happy w/ a Skel that WAS my lvl.
> >
> >Does it matter what type of bone chips are used to summon????
> >
> >
